response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for Time Code with pytest in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This document outlines various testing strategies for implementing time-sensitive tests using the popular pytest framework in Python 3.12 and beyond.
key_points: Utilize built-in assertions for basic time comparison tests.
Leverage external libraries such as `pytest-asyncio` and `freezegun` for more complex time manipulation tests.
Consider using fixtures to isolate and simplify test setup and teardown processes.
Adopt the 'arrange, act, assert' (AAA) design pattern for structuring your tests effectively.
Benchmark performance with `pytest-benchmark` to measure the execution speed of time-sensitive functions.
caveats: Testing time-sensitive code can be challenging due to its inherent dependency on the system clock.
Consider using a dedicated test environment for isolation and stability.
When utilizing external libraries, ensure compatibility with your project's Python version.
